Paper.Title: A COMPUTATIONAL GRAMMAR OF DISCOURSE-NEUTRAL PROSODIC PHRASING IN ENGLISH

Section.SectionTitle: A COMPUTATIONAL GRAMMAR OF DISCOURSE-NEUTRAL PROSODIC PHRASING IN ENGLISH
Section.Paragraph: J. Bachenko and E. Fitzpatrick AT & T Bell Laboratories Murray Hill, NJ 07974 We describe an experimental text-to-speech system that uses information about syntactic constituency, adjacency to a verb, and constituent length to determine prosodic phrasing for synthetic speech. A central goal of our work has been to characterize "discourse neutral" phrasing, i.e. sentence-level phrasing patterns that are independent of discourse semantics. Our account builds on Bachenko et al. (1986), but differs in its treatment of clausal structure and predicate-argument relations. Results so far indicate that the current system performs well when measured against a corpus of judgments of prosodic phrasing.
